Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create a 2-1 multiplexer. When sel=0, choose a. When sel=1, choose b..
Generated Code: module top_module (
	input [99:0] a,
	input [99:0] b,
	input sel,
	output [99:0] out
);


always @(a or b or sel) begin
if (sel == 0) begin
out = a;
end else if (sel == 1) begin
out = b;
end else begin
out = a + b;
end
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Build an AND gate using both an assign statement and a combinational always block. .
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input a, 
	input b,
	output out_assign,
	output reg out_alwaysblock
);


`include ""top_module.vh""

initial begin
out_assign = 1'b0;
out_alwaysblock = 1'b1;
end
endmodule // top_module

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Implement the boolean function z = (x^y) & x..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input x,
	input y,
	output z);


assign z = x ^ y;
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Implement a Mealy-type finite state machine that recognizes the sequence "101" on an input signal named x. Your FSM should have an output signal, z, that is asserted to logic-1 when the "101" sequence is detected. Your FSM should also have a negative edge triggered asynchronous reset. You may only have 3 states in your state machine. Your FSM should recognize overlapping sequences..
Generated Code: module top_module (
	input clk,
	input aresetn,
	input x,
	output reg z
);


mealy_fsm fsm(
.clk(clk),
.aresetn(aresetn),
.x(x),
.z(z)
);
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: For each bit in a 32-bit vector, capture when the input signal changes from 1 in one clock cycle to 0 the next. "Capture" means that the output will remain 1 until the register is reset (active high synchronous reset)..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input reset,
	input [31:0] in,
	output reg [31:0] out);


always @(posedge clk) begin
if(reset) begin
out[31:0] = in[31:0];
end else begin
out[31:0] = in[31:0];
end
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create 8 D flip-flops. All DFFs should be triggered by the positive edge of clk..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input [7:0] d,
	output reg [7:0] q);


always @(posedge clk) begin
q <= d;
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Build a two-bit saturating counter. The counter increments (up to a maximum of 3) when train_valid = 1 and train_taken = 1. It decrements (down to a minimum of 0) when train_valid = 1 and train_taken = 0. When not training (train_valid = 0), the counter keeps its value unchanged. areset is a positive edge triggered asynchronous reset that resets the counter to weakly not-taken (2'b01). Output state[1:0] is the two-bit counter value..
Generated Code: module top_module(
    input clk,
    input areset,
    input train_valid,
    input train_taken,
    output logic [1:0] state
);


logic [1:0] state;

always @(posedge clk) begin
if (areset) begin
state <= 2'b00;
end else if (train_valid && train_taken) begin
state <= 2'b01;
end
end
end

endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create a single D flip-flop..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input d,
	output reg q);


always @(posedge clk) begin
q <= d;
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: A single-output digital system with four inputs (a,b,c,d) generates a logic-1 when 2, 7, or 15 appears on the inputs, and a logic-0 when 0, 1, 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 13, or 14 appears. The input conditions for the numbers 3, 8, 11, and 12 never occur in this system. For example, 7 corresponds to a,b,c,d being set to 0,1,1,1, respectively. Determine the output out_sop in minimum sum-of-products form, and the output out_pos in minimum product-of-sums form.

.
Generated Code: module top_module (
	input a,
	input b,
	input c,
	input d,
	output out_sop,
	output out_pos
);


assign out_sop = a + b + c + d;
assign out_pos = 0;
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: The module assigns the output port to the same value as the input port combinationally..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input in,
	output out);


assign out = in;
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: A dual-edge triggered flip-flop is triggered on both edges of the clock. However, FPGAs don't have dual-edge triggered flip-flops, and always @(posedge clk or negedge clk) is not accepted as a legal sensitivity list. Build a circuit that functionally behaves like a dual-edge triggered flip-flop..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input d,
	output reg q);


assign q = d;
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: For each bit in an 8-bit vector, detect when the input signal changes from one clock cycle to the next (detect any edge). The output bit should be set the cycle after a 0 to 1 transition occurs..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input [7:0] in,
	output reg [7:0] anyedge);


always @(posedge clk) begin
anyedge <= in;
end

endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create a module with one input and one output that behaves like a wire..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input in,
	output out);


assign out = in;
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: For each bit in an 8-bit vector, detect when the input signal changes from 0 in one clock cycle to 1 the next (similar to positive edge detection). The output bit should be set the cycle after a 0 to 1 transition occurs..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input [7:0] in,
	output reg [7:0] pedge);


always @(posedge clk)
begin
if(in[7:0])
pedge[7:0] = in[7:0] + 1;
else
pedge[7:0] = in[7:0];
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create a circuit that has two 2-bit inputs A[1:0] and B[1:0], and produces an output z. The value of z should be 1 if A = B, otherwise z should be 0..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input [1:0] A,
	input [1:0] B,
	output z);


parameter DESCRIPTION = ""Create a circuit that has two 2-bit inputs A[1:0] and B[1:0], and produces an output z."";
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Given four unsigned numbers, find the minimum. Unsigned numbers can be compared with standard comparison operators (a < b). .
Generated Code: module top_module (
	input [7:0] a,
	input [7:0] b,
	input [7:0] c,
	input [7:0] d,
	output reg [7:0] min
);


always @(a,b,c,d) begin
min = {a,b,c,d};
end
endmodule

Task: Write Verilog program for the given description.
Description: Create 8 D flip-flops with active high asynchronous reset. The output should be reset to 0. All DFFs should be triggered by the positive edge of clk..
Generated Code: module top_module(
	input clk,
	input [7:0] d,
	input areset,
	output reg [7:0] q);


always @(posedge clk)
begin
if (resset)
q[7:0] <= d[7:0];
else
q[7:0] <= 0;
end
endmodule
